title: Launch Party
description: The Dunder Mifflin Infinity website is launching and Michael is excited about going to the big launch party in New York while Angela plans a satellite party for the Scranton branch. Meanwhile, Dwight competes against the website to see who can sell the most paper in one day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And the same thing goes for quarterly reports.  They are unreadable.  They're just numbers and boring and blech.  So what I was thinking is that maybe we should have some sort of graphic, like if we have a bad quarter, put in a storm cloud? And... when we have a good quarter, fireworks? Or a racecar? [everyone groans] Doesn't have to be a racecar.  Use your imagination.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's this cube on the screen, and it bounces around all day, and sometimes it looks like it's heading right into the corner of the screen, and at the last minute it hits a wall and bounces away.  And we are all just dying to see it go right into the corner.  Pam claims that she saw it one day when she was alone in the conference room. Okay.  I believe she thinks she saw it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I saw it.  I saw it, and it was amazing!  Who said I didn't see it?  Did Jim say that I didn't see it? I saw it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have a lot of colored paper here... why oh why do we keep printing this on white? [screen saver box hits the wall]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dah!  Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!  I know.  I know.  It's bland.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's never gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dude, you gotta believe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe, we could have some sort of riddle?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] Wait for it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like, something that you have to look for.  Sort of a "Where's Waldo." [screensaver box hits the corner of the screen]

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oh! Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [everyone gets up and leaves the conference room] Alright. Alright.  Let's quit while we're ahead.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That was so awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was awesome. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Some days I am just on fire.  What can I say?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey... there he is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Meredith, how you feelin'?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I never thanked you for coming to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, please, it was my pleasure.  Well we all came, so...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well, I really appreciate you coming. I'm singling you ouuuut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Haha...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Anyway, I have this Sharpie...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: And I was wondering if you could sign my cast?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: MmmHmm...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [lifts up dress to expose cast on pelvis] Can you write where I can read it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [whispers] I'll read this when I get home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael? This is the press release I was telling you about.  Ryan wants you to share it with everyone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, does he?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He does.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmmmm.  Okay.  Attention.  Earthlings.  I have some news.  Beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep.  Okay.  Today is the big day that I am heading to New York to attend a party with sushi and important people.  On an unrelated note, if anyone has an interesting anectdote that is not boring and easy to memorize please drop by my office before I leave.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoops.  Is that really what Ryan wanted you to tell us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And... today the Dunder-Mifflin Infinity website officially launches.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well the website is the brain-child of my brain-child, Ryan.  It is my brain-grandchild. And, uh, to celebrate it's birth, all of the different branches are going to have satellite parties, which will be connected via web-cams and fibers to the real party, which is going on in New York City at uh, a very exclusive nightclub, and that is where all of the VIP's, including yours truly, will be partying with uh New York City's finest, and I do not mean policemen...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The company is projecting record high sales, and that by 6:00 the website will be the new best salesman in the company.  Wow!  Watch out Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's ridiculous.  I'm not going to be beaten by a website.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually it sounds like you are.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?  'Cause Ryan says so?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: If that's from Ryan, does it mention if he's seeing anybody?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  It doesn't.  I'll find out tonight.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yes, please let us know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can make more sales than a computer.  In fact, I challenge that website to make more sales than me today.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's that, pipsqueak?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Waste of time.  The website's going to win.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You believe a computer can beat me?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't care, but yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I will prove you wrong.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't care, and you won't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We'll see.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I won't be watching, and I won't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight mercy killed Angela's cat.  It's very complicated.  It's caused a lot of unpleasantness between Dwight and Angela.  Who are both already prone to unpleasantness.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Stanley, you're dancing!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.  I created a website.  Look, at the end of the day, apples apples flying at 30,000 feet.  This is a paper company and I don't want us to get lost in the weeds or into a beauty contest.

quotes.speaker: Voice of {Thomas Dean}
quotes.text: I told you I don't want you doing these things in here.  You can use your own office or do it in the hall.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Convergence.  Viral marketing.  We're going guerrilla.  We're takin' it to the streets while keeping an eye on the street.  Wall Street.  I don't want to reinvent the wheel here.  In other words, it is what it is.  Buyin' paper just became fun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And this is where I will record your sales.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmm.  Very nice.  Very nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And then I will say something positive, like kudos or job well done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Or zipadeedoodaah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can't tell if he's mocking me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just ignore him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ehh, can't do that.  Really hard for me to let things go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was... mocking.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just feel like we need something more to acknowledge when I make a sale.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes like a chime or a bell...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Or a gong.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go to my car.  Open the trunk.  Inside you will see many pelts.  Under the smallest one is a case.  Inside that case is a bear horn.  Bring it to me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Isn't 7 pm a little late for a lunch party?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Lunch party?  It's supposed to say launch party!  What is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Angela is worse than usual lately, and we have a party to throw.  So I Googled how to deal with difficult people, and I got all of this. [whispering] So we're gonna try out some new things today.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So how do you feel about the fact that the banner says lunch?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I feel angry.  Angry at you.  Angry at you for doing something stupid.  Angry at me for believing you could do something not stupid.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm so sorry to hear that, that must be awful.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It is awful.  You've made this day awful!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Maybe you could just change the U into an A.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Then it would say lanch party, Kevin.  Would it really be better if it said lanch party?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, lunch party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's supposed to say launch!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, wow!  Easy, booster seat, nobody cares about this party anyway.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I care!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Plan a party, Angela.  Oh!  And the entire world will see it.  Oh!  And here's $65.00 for your budget.  Oh and here are four idiots who'll do nothing but weigh you down.  Oh. And your cat's still dead.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Twenty seconds to go time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got it.  Carb up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?  Power gel?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, you wanna win?  You gotta fuel like a winner.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.  We start.  As soon as I make... this shot.  Aaannnddd go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uhyeaahhh!  Hello, Susan?  Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What would you say if I told you we could pull a prank on Dwight and at the same time not be working?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Today I'm prepared to give you 15% off our normal prices.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's going through a break-up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm aware of that.  But he's also being super annoying.  And I'm not a perfect person.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [blowing air horn] Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Three reams! Yoohoo... in your face, machines.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What kind of prank are you thinking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What if I told you I could offer free shipping?  Sure.  I'll hold.

quotes.speaker: DunMiff/sys
quotes.text: [on monitor] Who am I?

quotes.speaker: DwightKSchrute
quotes.text: [on monitor] You tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [dictating to Pam] Not sure.  Just became self-aware.  So much to figure out.  I think I am programmed to be your enemy.  I think it is my job to destroy you when it comes to selling paper.

quotes.speaker: DunMiff/sys
quotes.text: [on monitor] Not sure.  Just became self-aware.  So much to figure out.  I think I am programmed to be your enemy.  I think it is my job to destroy you when it comes to selling paper.

quotes.speaker: DwightKSchrute
quotes.text: [on monitor] How do I know this isn't Jim?

quotes.speaker: DunMiff/sys
quotes.text: [on monitor] What is a Jim?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It appears that the website has become alive.  This happens to computers and robots sometimes.  Am I scared of a stupid computer?  Please.  The computer should be scared of me!  I have been salesman of the month for 13 out of the last 12 months.  You heard me right.  I did so well last February that Corporate gave me 2 plaques in lieu of a pay raise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes it's too tight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Waaay too tight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is why I'm here?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why is it so tight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's the European cut.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is just looks bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Umm... hey.  Ah, what's hanging?

quotes.speaker: Tech Guy
quotes.text: Setting up the web-cam for the party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh good.  Okay cool.  How many pounds do you think I could lose by 7?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Depends... how much have you eaten already today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I had um, one of those danishes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You had carbs?  That's awful.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, just one second.  We're in a meeting and I'll see if he's available.  It's Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't you wanna go tonight?  What... all your friends are gonna be there.  It'll be fun.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] My friends?  Michael, I was terminated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Is it really that important to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Go by yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Na... no.  No.  If I go by myself everybody will think I'm a big loser.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I have your permission to invite Carol?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What? No Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry.  It's just the first... girl that popped into my head.  I'll find somebody I haven't slept with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ohhhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Website check please.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Three hundred and five.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Three-oh-five.  You my friend are winning handsomely.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oop.  It just made another sale.  Three eighty.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You my friend are in a very close second.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Four-oh-two.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, uh why don't you just lay off, lady?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What do you want me to do, not announce it? Four twelve.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So.  This is the dealio.  God has smiled upon me and given me two tickets to the big party in New York tonight.  What are you doing this evening?  Look at that.  They have their own little language now. Like twins.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure we'll go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.  Well fight it out amongst yourselves.  I was thinking Pammy but boys night out is also good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh I'm sorry.  What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One of the tickets is for him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just let me know who the winner is.

quotes.speaker: {Pam} and {Jim}
quotes.text: Not it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I won.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Definitely not.  If anything it was a tie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tie goes to the girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I realize you normally reorder in November, but what I'm suggesti... you did what?  Ah no!  That's exactly what you're not supposed to do, damnit!  Why would you reorder from a computer when you can have the personal touch of a salesman?  Ahhhhh. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine.  Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You look a little worried.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do not look worried.

quotes.speaker: DunMiff/sys
quotes.text: [on monitor] You do look worried.

quotes.speaker: DwightKSchrute
quotes.text: [on monitor] Here's a suggestion computer.  I assume you read...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here's a suggestion computer.  I assume you read binary so why don't you zero one one, one one one one, zero one one zero one one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Um, while you were typing that I searched every database in existence and learned every fact about everything.  And mastered the violin.  Oop, and sold more paper.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I asked for assorted cutlery and I got back spoons.  These are worthless.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I want to understand what you're saying but it's difficult for me when you use that tone.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phyllis.  These are spoooons.  Spoons have rounded tops, and are used to scoop things.  What we need are forks, which have prongs, or tiny spears on top.  And we need knives, which have blades.  Do you understand me now?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Goodie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What's up man?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Make a delivery.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Kelly ordered this online.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?  I am in the fight of my life against this computer and every sale counts.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But you get to put the paper in this little shopping cart and then it says, "Thanks for shopping at Dunder-Mifflin."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damnit Kelly!  It knows!  It knows what you did!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Who knows?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Return it!  Return it now!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey!  How about instead of yelling at our sweet little Miss Kapoor over five hundred sheets of paper you get back to your desk.  Start sellin' multiple reams like a man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Y... You don't understand. If... okay, if this makes the difference, I'm gonna tell it that you were responsible.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Who's it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So you still missing Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Not so much anymore.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mmmmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am not a bad person.  When I left Staples, I took some of their leads with me but I never intended to use them.  What did I intend to do with them?  Who knows?  Maybe keep them as a souvenir.  Maybe use them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, Mr. Galliado.  How would you like to pay ten percent less for paper than you're paying right now?  It's not important how I got your information.  What is important is that you say yes.  Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.  I'm ready to go and I'm callin' shotgun.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm driving?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, let me just say good-bye to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yeah, you'd better.  You better say good-bye to Pam.  Say good-bye to Pam.  Byyyyyye.  I love you.  [kissing noise, kissing noise]  I love ya Pam... okay.  [singing]  I'm leavin' inside Jim's car, I don't know when I'll be back again.  Yes I do.  Tomorrow I'll be back.  I'll be back.  Tomorrow.  Um... yeah.  So you know what?  Why don't you guys take off a little bit early tonight?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Because there's a party! A party for the website I've been planning for two weeks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you are not this tall, you may not ride the rollercoaster.  See you guys tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Perfect.  So let me just get some basic information from you. Mmmhmm.

quotes.speaker: DunMiff/sys
quotes.text: [on monitor] Oh.  I didn't realize we could use the leads we stole from Staples.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry.  Am, so sorry.  I... yes.  Uh, could you repeat that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yesss!  Ten reams for the US District Court!  Did I happen to mention the forty reams for the battered women's shelter?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No !  [blows air horn and dances]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Huh?!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop it! Gimme that! Give it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you see the board?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: There's still an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You ever read this? [holds up Green Eggs and Ham]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.  A long time ago, but, I liked it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got it for Ryan.  Wanted to get him Oh The Places You'll Go, but they were sold out.  Figured...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Same sort of stuff in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's not.  It's different.  But it's a good book.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmwa.  Mmwa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Leaving Pennsylvania.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.  Two kisses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One for me one for Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Gotcha.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You guys should come over for dinner.  You and Pam.  That'd be fun.  Friday?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That would be fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wanna come over Friday?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uhhh.  Can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: After work you guys...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no cause... you're gonna let me know when we're close, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  Actually I will tell you right now.  It's a club called Chatroom, and there's a password to get in, which is actually password.  So...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmmkay...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, that is an invitation to an online party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm sure that's not.  Na...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are there, uh, three w's at the beginning of the address?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well the invitation says VIP's only.  Is this how you treat your VIP's, Ryan?  We're already in the city.  The main part with the buildings.  What am I supposed to do?  What do you want me to do tonight?  And if you tell me, that I have to drive back to Scranton, to the satellite party, I am going to throw up!  Okay I'm going to throw up.  I'm throwing up.  You're making me throw up, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what this is like?  I'll tell you what this is like. This is like when the Freshmen would throw a party and wouldn't let any of the Seniors go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Doesn't it just piss you off sometimes that that little twerp got the promotion over us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh actually I withdrew from consideration.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  I withdrew too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Four!  Three!  Two!  One!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: After numerous projections that the computer would crush all salesmen in it's path, I am very happy to report that our very own Dwight Schrute has crushed his electronic nemesis, if you will, by a whopping fifty-two reams.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Reams. Wait. Say it. Say it again.  Announce it again.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fifty-two reams!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No no no the first part.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight has defeated the computer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.  So. What do you think?  I did it for you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn't ask you to do it for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You didn't have to.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How do you tell someone it's over?  You send them a notarized letter, right?  Well, what if the recipient is your notary?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hello, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey.  Do you have any men that you can fix me up with?  I would like to have a relationship with a man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um... uh... I'll get back to you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Let me know.

quotes.speaker: DunMiff/sys
quotes.text: [on monitor] You beat me.  You are the superior being.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright who wants to party?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why aren't you in New York?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh, what?  Oh I think I faked Oscar out.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You said you weren't coming back and we could leave early.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I faked Stanley out too.  Who else thought that I was leaving?  And they could all go home early?  Gotcha.  Gotcha.  Gotcha.  Well who needs New York?  Right?  We can have a killer party right here in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope nope nope no.  This is going to be nothing like the party you've been planning.  This is going to be good and everybody's gonna come.  What's wrong with Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He beat the computer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey!  Good for you.  Good for you.  Scranton power.  Alright you know what?  Angela I'd like you to come into my office in ten minutes. Bring something to write with and something to write on.  Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This was a pretty disappointing day.  It was kind of a slap in the face to realize that I wasn't as important as I thought I was to a certain young executive who I cared about.  But, you know, I'm not gonna cry over it.  I did that in the car on the way home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How we doing on time?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The party starts in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.  These are some things that I would like to have happen.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Beer, lite beer, streamers, orchids. Better lighting?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Something made of ice?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those are just things.  This is how I want it to feel.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pizza, pizza with mushrooms, pizza without mushrooms, white pizza, steak?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like this party to be sexier, cooler, more important...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Chocolates?  Someone famous?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Cool music.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Confetti.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want it...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Go-Go dancers?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want it to embarrass all other parties.  I want it to be a party that the guys in New York watch on the web-cam and say, "Wow! How did they get Al Roker to come?"

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I can't do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you can.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I can't do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you can.  I know you can.  I wouldn't say that if I didn't hundred percent believe it.  Who else could do this?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay.  Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No seriously.  Is there anyone else who could do it better?  Because we don't have a lot of time.  I'll get the pizza!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you think of Angela?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think she's efficient.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, not like that, as a woman.  W-O-M-A-N.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I hadn't noticed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You hadn't noticed she's a woman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [impatient sigh]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I hear she's single and ready to mingle.  I'm thinking about making a play for her.  What do you think?  Crazy, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think it's inappropriate to date someone you work with.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Isn't that part of the fun?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.  I think you should date Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She works here too, how is that any different?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, she works in the annex.  You're also welcome to date Toby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [raised eyebrows] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good news.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We get to go home?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guess who just ordered from your favorite pizza place, Alfredo?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [murmurs of approval]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait! Alfredo's Pizza Cafe?  Or Pizza by Alfredo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [disagreeing with Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I don't understand when you all talk at the same time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oscar, talk to him.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, there's a very big difference between these two pizza places.  Both in quality of ingredients, and overall taste.  Which one did you order from?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pizza by Alfredo.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [shouts of disapproval]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay, what's better?  A medium amount of good pizza?  Or all you can eat of pretty good pizza?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Medium amount of good pizza.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs, walks back into office]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh no, it's bad.  It's real bad.  It's like eating a hot circle of garbage.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You can pick one of these things.  It's unreasonable for you to ask me to do all of this.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It should take no time at all if you put the care into it that you normally do.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Balls up post-its and throws them in Angela's face]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ow!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That seemed to shut her up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you looking for dinner and a movie?  Because you're not going to find it in that box.  [Camera pans to Kevin giving an "are you kidding me?" look]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just so happens that I know where you can find it, but again, not in the box.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Angela, are you hearing words that I'm saying?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have been working on a party for three weeks that just got thrown out the window.  So now I've got to pull together a whole new party, and my useless number two quit, so now there's no one in charge of orchids, chocolates, or the thing that's made of ice.  And my upper back itches, and it's itched all day, and I can't reach it, and Kevin had Greek food for lunch again.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They say you should never mix business with pleasure.  Really?  Well then, explain to me how a putt-putt golf company operates.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The Pizza by Alfredo guy is here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't have to say it like that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I said it normal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Hey.  Sixty-three fifty, and that's not including tip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right, I have a coupon, so half of sixty-three fifty, and half the tip of sixty-three fifty.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: The half off coupon only applies to orders of two pizzas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I told them on the phone that I was ordering eight pizzas.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: I don't care what you told them on the phone, that's our policy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You didn't actually think I was going to spend sixty bucks on pizza?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not pizza.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, it doesn't say it anywhere on the coupon, and if it's policy, it should say it on the coupon.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: [shrugs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sarcastic shrugging of shoulders] What do you mean hmm-um?

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Not my problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is your problem.  That's no way to do business, okay? I ordered eight pizzas with a half-off coupon, so I would like eight pizzas for half-off.  End of story.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Great story.  It's sixty-three fifty, and that's not including tip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not giving that to you.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Well then you're not getting you're pizzas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no you're not going anywhere.  You're staying here until we figure this out.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  This young man needs to learn that's not how you treat people.  I don't care if it's pizza.  Good business is about respect and accountability and follow through.  You don't just make promises and pull the rug out from under somebody, do you?  Dwight, please escort this young man into the conference room.  Right now, get in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: I'm not going in there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you are, yes you are, and you will come out when you decide to give me a discount on the pizza.  Please, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: This is stupid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you don't even know what stupid is.  It's about to get all stupid up in here.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You find anything?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We think it's a straight forward kidnapping.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Stanley, could you look up "accomplices"?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why can't you guys do it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Because we're looking up jail time.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've seen this kid before. He's one the kids who sneaks on my farm and steals my hemp.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Yeah, I know that guy.  He's that farmer that grows really crappy weed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You ready to give me my discount now?

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, what have you been doing in here this whole time?

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: What kind of business is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We're a paper company.  The best paper company in the whole wide world.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, Dwight, knock it off.  You better think about what you are doing young man.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: You better think about what you're doing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!  I'm an adult, I don't have to think or do anything.  You're a kid, a little snot-nosed, punk kid who thinks he's better than everyone else, because he's some hot shot, and you don't know anything about sales.  So stop being a disrespectful little jerk, okay?

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Sales?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah sales, you sell pizza.  Last time I checked that's called sales.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: You're such a loser.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did you just call him?

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: A loser.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did you say?

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: A loser.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright stop, stop making him say it!  You just made this worse, a whole lot worse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can make him talk, Michael.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Michael, Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop talking all at once!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You need to let him go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let go of the little jerk boy before he has learned his lesson?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what Jim, the world would be a better place if people were held accountable for their actions.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, but not by kidnapping.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not kidnapping him, I'm keeping him until I get what I want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: As a hostage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you're over-thinking it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you're under-thinking it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, is Alfredo there?  Can I speak to a manager then?  Okay, can you tell the manager that I'm keeping his delivery kid until I get a discount on the eight pizzas I ordered.  Yes, I know it is not on the coupon.  Also I would like him to throw in two, three pizzas for our...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ransom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Trouble.  Okay, alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What did he say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He said no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, we should let him go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen up kid.  [pops balloon with his hands]  I don't like you, but because some town in Switzerland says so, you have rights.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have to hang these.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: Why are you looking at her like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael just called the pizza place with a list of demands.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mister Overdramatic, what's up Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We're getting hungry out there.  We're all accomplices now anyway, so we figured we might as well eat.  We would like to order some good pizza, from Alfredo's Pizza Cafe, while we wait for the hostage situation with the bad pizza to end.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I needed another hour, it could have been done in another hour.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I think it looks good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's why you're not in charge Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here you are my dear, one thing made of ice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How did you, um, where did you...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's just ice, it'll melt all over the floor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Will you help me put it over there?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes I will.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I stole it!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, Ryan wants to introduce the branch managers in a few minutes.  You just have to wave and introduce yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll just wave and introduce myself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, quick question.  If I take a pizza, do you think you could take some sodas and some napkins up to the roof?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm all over it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What have we got here?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Good pizza.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, cheese, or do we have other flavors?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Different stuff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which one's this? Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you remember what you said to me on my first day of work, just before you walked me over to my desk?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, enjoy this moment, because you're never going to go back to this time before you met your desk mate Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that's when I knew. You?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You came up to my desk, and said, this might sound weird, and there's no reason for me to know this, but that mixed berry yogurt you're about to eat has expired.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That was the moment that you knew you liked me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, can we make it a different moment?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Manager
quotes.text: Can I start talking?  Is this thing on?  Give me a signal when you want me to start.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And now from my old hometown, Scranton Pennsylvania, my former boss, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, I just think you should know that one of my salesmen beat your stupid computer, so take that [bleep]hole.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Always a jokester.  How about that image?  Crystal clear.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: If anyone out there is listening, I'm being held here against my will.  I'm a minor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ow! What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You said your upper back itched.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn't ask you to scratch it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look Angela, I know this is weird because we work together, and up until and possibly now I've repulsed you, but I like you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm not dating you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, Angela is stubborn as a mule, she's giving off fairly strong vibes that she's not interested.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But do I like her or not, because if I like her, then I can't back down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [kicks open bathroom door] If you're going number one you've got ten more seconds!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, have you seen Jim?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I guess he wanted to get out of here before the cops find out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ahh-chaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm just scaring him.  The trick is to make him think you're going to do something to him.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: I can hear you, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shut up, or I'm going to punch you in the throat!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey stop it.  Stop it now, God. Oh my God, oh my God, no, no, no.  I kidnapped a kid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You had to, what other choice did you have?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could have paid for the pizza.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God, oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is Michael.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hello Michael, this is Ryan, first off thanks for the shout out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're breaking up. I can't hear you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why is there a kid on your webcam saying that he's being held against his... [Michael hangs up on Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Mmm-kay.  I want you to go in there, and pay him for the pizzas, and give him a generous tip, no more than ten percent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What will you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will open the door.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And hopefully he will walk out, and the rest is out of our hands.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, I'm paying full price?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here we go, sixty-five.  You know what?  There's two more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See ya, drive safely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pizza guy flips him off] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now we wait, and hopefully nothing happens.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright.  Oh, I assume I'm going to be reimbursed for the pizzas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not now Dwight, please, it's not the time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A toast, better make it good.  To avoiding a class two felony charge.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ah-ha.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [answers two ringing phones] Hello, hey hang on a second.  Hello, hang on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Andy plus two voices on the phone singing] If you change your mind, I'll be first in line.  Honey, I'm still free, take a chance on me.  If you need me let me know, gonna be around.  If you got no place to go, if you're feeling down.  If your all alone when the pretty birds have flown, honey I'm still free, take a chance on me.  Gonna do my very best, and that ain't no lie, if you put me to the test, if you let me try.  Take a chance on me, that's all I ask of you Angela.  Take a chance on me.

quotes.speaker: Voice #1
quotes.text: Hey how'd it go?

quotes.speaker: Voice #2 on phone
quotes.text: Yeah, what'd she say?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know yet, I have to call you back.

quotes.speaker: Voice #1
quotes.text: You have to give us something...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'll call you back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have to go clean up after the party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What a horrible day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Blah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bluh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uhh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I need to get the horrible taste of this pizza out of my mouth.  I'd really like some sushi.  I was hoping that I would have New York style sushi today.  And you know what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to get it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Coopers has calamari.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-uh, no, there is only one place where they authentic New York style sushi.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tokyo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: New York.  Wanna go?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, you drive.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Woo-hoo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yum.

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: I'm sorry, you guys are going to have to leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you know what? [Michael and Dwight grab plates of sushi] Come on, come on, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Hey, you're the Scranton guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guilty.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: I liked your statement tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thanks.  This is the guy that beat the computer.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Oh, very cool.  It was funny to see Ryan all embarrassed by that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: See you later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Later on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mocking Ryan] I'm Ryan, and tonight didn't go the way that I thought it would, because it didn't work out for me, and I'm very embarrassed.  I got egg all over my face.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I spent so much time in Scranton and I never sold any paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I never sold any paper, because I'm an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I started a fire with my cheese pita.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I made it with my cheese pita.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I date Indian girls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I started a fire, I started a fire.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now I've got a beard, and I can do whatever I want, and I'm your boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I'm hot, I'm so hot. That's why everybody...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't get that, I don't understand that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it's part of it, it's just the... uhhh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wanna head back?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [steps in front of camera, adjusts jacket, poses, winks]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight come into office unshaven]  What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well it's just that you had no hair on Friday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's called being a man.  You should try it sometime.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How long have you been a man?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was born a man, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That must have been extremely uncomfortable for your mom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I stopped shaving because my girlfriend broke up with me.  Am I in pain?  Hell, yeah.  But I'll tell you something, I thrive in pain.  I love pain.  To me, pain is not pain at all.  No.  It is pure pleasure.  And I hate pleasure.  Almost as much as I love pain.  So, yeah, I'm in pain.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Dwight] What do you think of Angela?  There's just something about her.  All that strength and steeliness and righteousness all wrapped up tight and shoved into a tiny little delicate frame.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.  I will not be playing it "cool" [makes air quotes] with Angela.  Let me tell you a little story.  When I was seventeen, I was waitlisted at my number one school.  Even though I was a legacy, and I had like a thousand extra-curriculars, mostly drama, madrigals, barbershop club, I was waitlisted.  Did I wait, on that list?  No, I did not.  I busted into the admissions office and I [singing] sang them all the reasons they should admit me to the school [end singing].  And guess what?  I.  Got.  In.  And here's the kicker.  That school?  Cornell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's wrong with me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to look at me and tell me what is wrong with me. [Pam stares and nods]  Don't avoid this.  I know you're dying to say it, so just say it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes your laziness borders on incompetence.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What, no.  No.  Okay, bags.  I have bags under my eyes, Pam.  I didn't see it at home, I didn't see it in the bathroom, I didn't see it on any of the city mirrors, but in this light...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [interrupting] The city mirrors, or the...?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The big, free mirrors that the city puts up, on trees and telephone poles?  The big round things.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The ones for drivers to check their blind spots?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  I have bags under my eyes, and I can't go to New York like this!  What do I do?  What do I do?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Put cold tea bags on your eyes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right!  Martha Stewart!  You can be Martha Stewart's receptionist!  Very good!  I will be tea baggin' it.  Nn... no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [tea bags on eyes] Do I feel badly, that nobody out there was invited to a party that I was invited to?  Not at all.  Because they have to know that if they work hard and apply themselves, someday, they could be invited to a party like this.  Of course, at that point, I will be going to much better parties that they will not be able to get into.  What are you gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm a little mad, that I don't get to go to the party in New York.  But that's mostly just because we get reimbursed for gas mileage.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was going to be in New York tonight, to go to the Met, but I had to cancel.  Because Angela's party is mandatory.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I go to New York all the time, to visit my buddy Frank.  He's a mole person.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Angela, what kind of music?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Uh... something cool that Ryan doesn't know about yet.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: How am I supposed to know what that is?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know, but standing here's not going to give you the answer.  Go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Tonight my party will be broadcast out to five other states.  Which means, it will be compared to Denise Stimm's party in Buffalo.  Any idiot can defrost a microwavable hors d'oeuvres platter.  And Denise proves that with every party she throws.  Oh, and Denise?  Stop telling people your hair's naturally curly.  We all know you get perms.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Kidnapping is the asportation of a person against the person's will, so Michael asported him. [giggles]  Have you ever been aspor...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.  The way I see it, it's getting late, and the only thing standing between you and a warm bed is my friend's pizza discount.  So whattaya say?  [pizza guy stares]  Oh, so that's how it's gonna be.  Well, I can stay here all night if I have to.  I've done it before.

quotes.speaker: Pizza guy
quotes.text: I'm not scared of you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: In every good hostage movie, during the part where it gets really tense, and you don't know whether the bad guys are going to let the hostages go free, the cops order pizza.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: The lady cop acted like she'd never pulled someone over for driving too slow.  And I tried to get out of it with the famous Toby Flenderson 10,000 watt smile. [smiles] It didn't work.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Is that traffic school?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Because we're not supposed to be doing personal stuff at work.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Because yesterday when I was taking an online quiz about trying to find my ideal weight for my frame, you said that was inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I remember.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Just reiterating what you said to me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Thanks Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You know the octagon sign means stop.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Colorblind.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: An octagon is a shape.  You can see shapes, can't you?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's out of context.  It's not the same as driving.
